definitions.definition: either of the two round soft parts at the front of a woman’s body that produce milk when she has had a baby

examples.text: She put the baby to her breast.
**breast milk**
**breast cancer**
She had breast-augmentation surgery.
Getting breast implants entails major surgery.
She discovered a lump in her breast.

definitions.definition: the similar, smaller part on a man’s body, which does not produce milk
the top part of the front of your body, below your neck

examples.text: He cradled the child against his breast.

definitions.definition: the part of a piece of clothing that covers your chest

examples.text: A row of medals was pinned to the breast of his coat.

definitions.definition: the front part of a bird’s body

examples.text: breast feathers
The robin has a red breast.

definitions.definition: meat from the front part of the body of a bird or an animal

examples.text: **chicken/turkey breasts**
breast of lamb
breast of duck in orange sauce
Skinless breasts are around 170 calories per serving,
Would you like breast or leg?

definitions.definition: having the type of chest or breasts mentioned

examples.text: a small-breasted/full-breasted woman
bare-breasted
the yellow-breasted male of the species

definitions.definition: the part of the body where the feelings and emotions are thought to be

examples.text: a troubled breast

definitions.definition: to show that you feel sorry about something that you have done, especially in public and in an exaggerated way
to tell the truth about something so that you no longer feel guilty

examples.text: He made a clean breast of everything and admitted taking the money.

wordOrigin: Old English brēost, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch borst and German Brust.
